Reviews.Title: SO DISAPPOINTED!!
Reviews.Author: momofgirls
Reviews.Content: First of all, I sure wish I would've researched this camera a bit more before I bought it! It was on sale, and my daughter had asked for a camera for her 7th birthday. Well, we have had the camera in operation about a month, if that, and it is TOTAL JUNK! Although I didn't pay much for it, I still wasted over $40 and now have to replace it!!On the first use, we noticed more pictures than not were blurry...we hadn't gotten around to printing any of them off, but from what you can see on the tiny LCD screen, alot of pics had to be deleted. After the 2nd or 3rd use, the shutter would not close when the camera was turned off...I couldn't even manually try to shut it just to keep fingerprints, dust, etc. off of the lens. Then today, my daughter turned it on, and the LCD screen was like SNOW! You couldn't even make out the pictures at all.So....after writing this review, I will be throwing this month-old camera directly in the trash!!! And btw, I don't write many reviews and certainly have never, ever written one this negative...but I definitely felt compelled to let others know not to waste their money!!!!

Reviews.Title: One star is TOO MANY
Reviews.Author: Jeff Thorsgaard
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take photos of some signs I made.  The camera is absolute GARBAGE!  My 4 year old cell phone takes better pictures.  It has NO internal memory, so an SD card is REQUIRED, and batteries aren't included - they don't even give you any of those ultra-cheap ones with the Chinese writing all over them..  $39.99 PLUS an SD card (~$15) PLUS an 8 pack of batteries (because you can not buy 3 ANYWHERE) (~$5)..EQUALS $60 for a piece of pure junk.Can't even return it because I bought it at Wally world..EXTREMELY DISSATISFIED!

Reviews.Title: do not buy this piece of junk!!!!!
Reviews.Author: vocalconsumer
Reviews.Content: This camera was cheap, sure, but not worth one penny!!!!  It is a piece of TRASH!  It has no user manual, and when i looked up the user manual online, it was so ridiculously complicated!  What is the point of a simple digital camera if it is not simple to use?  This is a PIECE OF TRASH!  It takes HORRIBLE PICTURES.  It is impossible to figure out and use.  Vivitar just alienated me forever.  This camera is TRASH - JUNK - DO NOT BUY this awful camera - that is as clear as i can state my opinion without resorting to bad language. I tried to get this to post with ZERO stars.

Reviews.Title: Dont Purchase This Item!
Reviews.Author: M. Jones
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera yesterday for my 3 year old.  It's not even good enough for him. It is a horrible camera.  The pictures are very low quality and there are too many symbols.  It is going back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: isnt
Reviews.Content: Hah, this camera truly is terrible. BUT that is the reason I purchased it. I have been trying to replicate the old holga look in a digital camera. I think I've found my match. Actually this might even be a bit worse than the holga, but it has the digital lo-fi look I was searching for. Cheap, crappy and decent black and white. Anyway, if you aren't looking for the lo-fi look then skip this camera entirely because it is awful. Even when you use the flash nothing is sharp, in focus or good looking. Do yourself a favor, spend another hundred more and get a low end canon or nikon point and shoot. They know what their doing.

Reviews.Title: Junk Junk Junk
Reviews.Author: Mao
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews of this camera are dead on. It may be the single worst digital camera I have ever held in my hand. It was purchased for my daughter at Christmas and the pictures are blurry beyond belief. I went through numerous attempts to rectify the blurriness by systematically changing parameters to try and figure out what was causing the problems. After several wasted hours, it was clear that the camera is simply garbage. No manual comes with it and it is NOT intuitively obvious to work. For example, the camera ALWAYS defaults to the flash being off and I can't seem to make it default to an on or even auto flash. In the end, the thirty or so bucks you will spend on this camera to please a child is money thrown down the drain. I will never, EVER buy another Vivitar product again. I will also use my influence to discourage anyone else from making the Vivitar product mistake that I made.Friends, do yourself a favor.....when you are tempted to purchase an inexpensive ViviCam 7022, don't just walk away from it ..... RUN !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: I hope Target will take this junk back
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Sandra L. Graham "glitterspazz"
Reviews.Content: Wow. Lesson learned. Don't EVER buy a 40.00 digital camera. (even if it is for a 10 year old). 40.00 is way to much for this camera. Pictures are pretty much horrible. Can't figure out how to change the time and date either. Instruction manual is worthless. I hope Target will take this back :)

Reviews.Title: Horrific!
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Dubin
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for our 7-yr old daughter from close friends.  She was so excited to have her own camera, after "borrowing" ours for so long.  Every review so far is right on - blurry pics, poor quality on non-blurry shots, terrible color recognition.  The flash defaults to "off" and no setting to fix it.  And now, the straw that broke my back... I went to take pics off the SD card and put them into my daughter's pic folder only to realize that the camera started the file count all over at pic001.jpg after the first time I downloaded them off the card.  Which most of you will recognize means that this time I had to either overwrite the existing, different photo (nope) or I had to rename each new file manually (yep).This is the first review I've ever done on a product.  It's that bad, I had to.  Stay away.  Spend your $40 on a used Canon or Nikon on Craigslist before you buy this.

Reviews.Title: Well... it's cheap
Reviews.Author: W. Wright "Mad Tinkerer"
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap camera for a situation in which I was pretty sure it might not survive and this one fit the bill.Image quality is quite poor, focus is really iffy up close, and it's interface is confusing... but hey, it was cheap!

Reviews.Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY THIS CAMERA SUCKS
Reviews.Author: Christiana Clark
Reviews.Content: I WISH I WOULD OF READ THE REVIEWS BEFORE WASTING MY TIME AND MONEY. FIRST THE CAMERA WILL NOT READ MY SD CARD IT IS BRAND NEW I TRIED 2 DIFFERENT ONES IT STATED CARD IS FULL WHEN IT IS NOT. PICTURES ARE BLURRY AND NOT GOOD QUALITY NOT TO MENTION IT IS CONFUSING TRYING TO NAVIGATE THROUGH THE MENU. SPEND A LITTLE MORE AND STAY AWAY FROM VIVITAR CAMERAS TRY A KODAK OR SOMETHING IF YOU DO BUY THIS YOU WILL BE SORRY AND END UP WRITING A SIMILIAR REVIEW

Reviews.Title: Its cheap
Reviews.Author: Kedrigern
Reviews.Content: I bought based solely on its price.  I have has several of theses in the  past so I am not disappointed with the low quality photos.  In my work I ruin about 4-6 cameras each year.  Digital cameras usually do not like to be dipped in wet mud, so the cheaper they are the better.  For a 7 megapixel, the photo quality is abysmal; I have had 1 megapixel cameras take better photos.  Flash recycle time is quite slow and the flash is very weak.  Buy it only if you want cheap and are wiling to tolerate it numerous drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: Cartoon Camera
Reviews.Author: JJames74
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a $40 as a cheap point-n-shoot for work. However, I honestly think I would have gotten more for the money if I would have went to the toy department and bought a hot pink camera for Ages 3- which lets the user pretend they are "taking pictures" of Mickey Mouse & Goofy. At least I would have had something to show my boss then. As it is I'm just standing here like Wiley Coyote out on a cliff right before he drops. Might as well take the time to write this quick review online before I get fired to warm someone else - this camera reads "Vivtar" but it should say Acme.

Reviews.Title: Not as Bad as They Say
Reviews.Author: Charles S. Tritt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to keep in my car to have it handy in case I need to document anything. It appears perfect for this use. It uses regular AAA alkaline batteries that should hold their charge well over time, unlike rechargeable batteries that self discharge. The camera is mostly point and shoot with a fixed focus (1.5 m to infinity) lens (with an optional macro setting for close-ups). By default the camera is in 3 MP setting, but this can be changed to 7.1 and this change stays in effect until the batteries are changed. There are many other settings, but none of these really need to be adjusted.Users of higher end cameras shouldn't have problems figuring out the controls, even with the limited manual provided. The camera has three modes - still, video and playback. The set button is used to access a collection of settings menu. That is really all you need to know.The case is plastic. I'm sure it wont hold up to rough handling, but I don't plan to use it that much.One reviewer indicated the lens cover stopped working. This is odd in that the camera doesn't have a built in lens cover. Other comments indicated the users were too close to their subjects or didn't hold the camera still. Used correctly, mine takes excellent pictures.This is an inexpensive camera with somewhat limited features for a good price. I'd describe it as a good value.

Reviews.Title: Vititar camera
Reviews.Author: Raymond Harris
Reviews.Content: received camera, different color (silver)  but the camera works really well..I would probably buy another or a similar product.  I received the camera when promised, and I was pleased with everything.

Reviews.Title: vivitar vivican digital camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: gift for grandson he is a great photographer for an 11 year old boy he has shown this from a very early age

Reviews.Title: yes, a rip-off
Reviews.Author: Jill Roberta
Reviews.Content: It includes a "fashion wrist strap," but the hole for the strap doesn't actually go all the way through.  It's a wrist strap, all right, but not one you can actually use with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not worth 5¢
Reviews.Author: Jackie Long "Lakewoodcpl"
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worst camera made.  The battery life is about 20 pictures at best and the overall quality of the pictures is nil.  My suggestion is to pay a few more bucks and the buy something better.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!
Reviews.Author: S. Ready
Reviews.Content: This camera/video recorder is AWFUL!  The shutter NEVER closed.  Not even once.  It was "snowy" from the get go, like an old antenna TV with a bad reception.  I thought it might just be the display, but nope, uploaded pictures and video look exactly like the LCD screen.  7.1 mega pixels my butt.  Also on the videos there were three spots that were pixels that didn't pick up video, one was yellow/white, and the other two were red.  AWFUL!  Target had better take this piece of crap back.  I just bought it today.  I wasn't expecting HD but this isn't worth $10 let alone $45.  I only gave it one star because it wouldn't let me give it zero.  The people that gave this thing 3 stars must be on medication.

Reviews.Title: Life saver
Reviews.Author: STS
Reviews.Content: This camera saved my trip. My regular camera had no battery charged and a friend of mine let me borrow this camera. First I thought what is this but at least saved for what i need it. The pictures were okay I actually thought i was going to be worse but we got nice pictures.So if u wanna saved some money this camara is not the bet but at least it will help you out if you need it.

Reviews.Title: The Vivitar Vivicam series are not so much cameras as Facebook accessories
Reviews.Author: Richard Sonnenfeld
Reviews.Content: I own a Canon Powershot SX110 and before that I had a Fuji Finepix and before that a Canon GX1.My wife wanted a digital camera and Walmart (the only place in town that even sold cameras) had only Vivitars.  How bad could it be, I asked myself?Well I found out.As stated by others, the quality is worse than cel phone.  The controls made no sense.  All the camera seems to allow you to do is todecide whether to upload to Facebook or Picasa or Youtube.  That's cool enough ... I guess ... but how about THE PICTURES!The screen was full of little icons, suggesting there were things to set ... shutter speed ... ISO ... resolution?  But I couldnot find ANYTHING you could set.  OK ... it's cheap,maybe you could not set shutter speed ... but I could not figure out how to set the resolution.  The camera came with a CD ... maybe therewas a manual on it, but after messing with it for half an hour and not being able to figure it out I just put it back in the box andwe returned it the next day.  Of course it is risky to buy technology at Walmart cause there is no way to try it.  Fortunately Walmartlets you return things once you discover they are junk.Of course the lens is tiny, so I should have realized it wasn't a real camera.  It would be fine outdoors I guess if you just wanted to push the button ...but ... really, if it's not better than a cel phone why bother?

Reviews.Title: Total JUNK, RIP OFF
Reviews.Author: Ms. Casillas
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe this company even dares to sell such a complete piece of garbage. I bought it on either sale or clearance at Office Max for about $35. It is supposed to be 7 mp, which should take beautiful, clear shots. NO! It appears to not even be 7 KB quality!!! My very first pictures are not only extremely BLURRY, but have a bunch of LINES across all of the pictures!

Reviews.Title: No
Reviews.Author: Elliot
Reviews.Content: "Did you take that picture with a potato?"Every time, you'll be wondering if that's what you paid for. This camera makes lemons look like an HD camera, of which this is not. Most phones can take better pictures than this dedicated camera out of the 90s. After buying you'll live in a state of perpetual regret after spending $30 on this dinosaur. The LCD screen lacks a clear resolution and finds itself plagued with a grainy film. HD photos, these are not. Spend your money on a real camera.

Reviews.Title: ViviCam camera
Reviews.Author: hp person
Reviews.Content: From the beginning, the screen on the back was not clear and has since gone blank. It now requires repair

Reviews.Title: Vivator7022
Reviews.Author: TammyZ
Reviews.Content: Don't buy it, it's junk.  Not user friendly!  It will make you unfriendly trying to figure it out, and the quality of pictures very poor.

Reviews.Title: why didn't i check online before buying this junk
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: i figured id buy this thing for my 4 year old daughter to use. i cant get it to take one photo that is not blurry 7.1mp? i have a cell phone with 1.3mp camera and it takes alot better pictures and video.

ProductInfo.Features:
7.1 Megapixel CCD
4x Digital Zoom
1.8" LCD Screen
AntiShake Technology
HD Video Mode
ProductInfo.Name: Vivitar ViviCam V7022 Digital Camera (Strawberry)
